comments.body:
I'm a bit concerned that we entangle the idea of "use and build C++ modules when building ROOT, using the compiler you want to build ROOT with" and "use C++ modules for dictionaries, using the clang libraries from interpreter/llvm".

Can you clarify that maybe by more explicit names, e.g. here `usedictcxxmodues`?

Well, it's not just dictionaries that have modules, but also all external libraries, so that's rather confusing with a dict in the name.

Maybe we just take over the original flag we have (`cxxmodules`) because that's the most obvious thing for the central idea: Have C++ modules in ROOT. And we always called the project "C++ modules in ROOT", so that name fits to how we presented it to the outside.

The compile time modules which is only interested for people using the most recent clang can be `compile_with_modules` or something like that.

Axel, the variable usecxxmodules is temporary. Once everything works (which IMO is not far from now) we will remove it and make it default behavior.

I do not think we should spend time in making the swap of the compiletime/runtime cxxmodules.
Add comment: `// Allow change of CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD`?

comments.body: Where does this variable come from? I couldn't find it in the documentation.
You can look through CMake to see them in the meantime, here's the compiler file for CMake 3.1 and g++: <https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/blob/v3.1.0/Modules/Compiler/GNU-CXX.cmake>

set(configoptions ${ROOT_CONFIGARGS})
set(configstd ${CMAKE_CXX${CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD}_STANDARD_COMPILE_OPTION})
get_filename_component(altcc ${CMAKE_C_COMPILER} NAME)
get_filename_component(altcxx ${CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER} NAME)

comments.body: Isn't this going to be the directory one level up from what you want?

I checked ROOTConfig.cmake and it looks like this:
https://gist.github.com/oshadura/de72ec565aa6152dc40eabf0683b1800
Could you just use `message(STATUS )` to print both variables after calling find_package(ROOT) and paste the result here, please?
Shouldn't they both be the same?

I suppose that was from *within a ROOT build*, and not as-if-external-project? And instead of `get_filename_component(ROOT_BINARY_DIR \"\${ROOT_BINDIR}\" ABSOLUTE)`, wouldn't `set(ROOT_BINARY_DIR "${ROOT_BINDIR}")` be enough (given that `ROOT_BINDIR` is already normalized to `ABSOLUTE` a few lines up?

@amadio @Axel-Naumann yes it was from within ROOT, from outside (standalone roottest) it is:

 oksana@oksana-dellxps  ~/CERN_sources/roottest/builds   fix_root_binary_dir  cmake ..
...
-- /home/oksana/CERN_sources/root-cxxmodules/builds/bin
-- /home/oksana/CERN_sources/root-cxxmodules/builds/bin

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +677,681 @@set(ROOT_BINARY_DIR_SETUP "
# Deprecated value, please don't use it and use ROOT_BINDIR instead.
get_filename_component(ROOT_BINARY_DIR \"\${ROOT_BINDIR}\" ABSOLUTE)
")
set(ROOT_MODULE_PATH "\${_thisdir}/modules")
